page.title: 11Tourism in Rathmell NW
page.content: This block does not have a long list of "attractions" that pull tourists from all over the country to view them. It is a{quiet, rural {backwater}where farming life goes on much as it has done for a number of years. But perhaps it is just this that does attract some people for a holiday: a{complete change}from the daily hurly-burly of city life. There are{cottages to rent}and some farms have made part of their buildings into {holiday accommodation, along the lines {of the French "gite". {By road,}the holiday maker will find easy{access}to the limestone scenery in the{Dales National Park,}to the hills and lakes of the{Lake {District,}to the forest of Bowland and to the coast of{Morecambe Bay.
